member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageConfiguration
member.summary: Provides methods for changing this library's global configuration.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageConfiguration.SetLicenseKey(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the purchased license key to register the product and remove any limitations.
member.param: The purchased license key. If the value is null or empty, the license will be unset.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.TransformQuality
member.summary: Defines the possible interpolation algorithms that are used when geometrical transformations applied to images.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.TransformQuality.High
member.summary: Best quality algorithm with usually lowest speed. The appropriate interpolation algorithm will be automatically selected to reach the desired quality.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.TransformQuality.Medium
member.summary: Medium quality algorithm with usually medium speed. The appropriate interpolation algorithm will be automatically selected to reach the desired quality.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.TransformQuality.Low
member.summary: Lowest quality algorithm with usually highest speed. The appropriate interpolation algorithm will be automatically selected to reach the desired quality.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorModel
member.summary: Defines the supported color models.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorModel.Rgb
member.summary: RGB is an additive color model in which red, green, and blue light are added together in various ways to reproduce a broad array of colors.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorModel.Grayscale
member.summary: Grayscale, also known as black-and-white, is a color model composed exclusively of shades of gray, varying from black at the weakest intensity to white at the strongest.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorModel.Cmyk
member.summary: CMYK is a subtractive color model used in color printing. CMYK refers to the four inks used in color printing: cyan, magenta, yellow, and key (black).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorModel.Lab
member.summary: Lab is a three-dimensional color model, where the L stands for the lightness of the color, the “a” is the redness vs. greenness, while the “b” is the yellowness vs. blueness.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Enum`1
member.summary: Strongly typed version of Enum with Parsing and performance improvements.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifDictionary
member.summary: Represents a dictionary of EXIF entries.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifDictionary.CreateEntry(GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates an entry specific to this dictionary type.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifEntry
member.summary: Represents an entry in an EXIF dictionary.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageInfo
member.summary: Provides properties for reading image information and metadata. If also processing the image is required then class should be used.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified image file.
member.param: The path to the image to load.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified image stream.
member.param: The stream containing the image to load.

member.summary: Releases all resources used by this instance.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageInfoBase
member.summary: Represents image information and metadata. This is a base class for internal use which cannot be instantiated. Use the derived class instead.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageInfoBase.Reader
member.summary: The underlying image reader.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageInfoBase.Format
member.summary: Get the file format of the image.

member.summary: Gets the width of the image in pixels.

member.summary: Gets the height of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageInfoBase.DpiX

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageInfoBase.IptcDictionary
member.summary: Gets a dictionary representing IPTC data stored in the image.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat
member.summary: Defines the supported image file formats for loading.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: JPEG (Joint Photographic Experts Group) is the most popular bitmap image format for storing digital photos using lossy compression.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.Png
member.summary: PNG (Portable Network Graphics) was created to replace the obsolete GIF format due to a legal problem caused by the LZW algorithm used in GIF.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.Gif
member.summary: GIF (Graphics Interchange Format) is a bitmap image format which works well for saving any type of grayscale or 256 color image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.WebP
member.summary: WebP is an image format developed by Google Inc. This format provides lossless and lossy compression for images on the web.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.Bmp
member.summary: BMP (Bitmap Picture) is a standard bitmap image format used to store digital images on Microsoft Windows operating systems.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.Tiff
member.summary: TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) is a bitmap file format for storing images that is very popular among professional photographers and graphic artists.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.Eps
member.summary: EPS (Encapsulated PostScript) is a PostScript document used as a graphics file format.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.Psd
member.summary: PSD (Photoshop Document) is a native bitmap file format of the Adobe® Photoshop® program using lossless data compression.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageLoadFormat.Raw
member.summary: A camera raw image file contains minimally processed data from the image sensor of either a digital camera, image scanner, or motion picture film scanner.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTask
member.summary: Provides methods for processing a source image in a chained manner and saving the resulting image(s). This class also allows reading source image information and metadata. class can be preferred to this class if no processing is required.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTask.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified image file.
member.param: The path to the image to load.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTask.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified image stream.
member.param: The stream containing the image to load.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTask.Undo
member.summary: Undoes the last command in the chain.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTask.UndoAll
member.summary: Undoes all commands in the chain.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTask.Save(System.String,System.Nullable{GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat})
member.summary: Executes all the commands in the chain and saves the resulting image to the specified file path.
member.param: The absolute path to save the image to.

The file format used to save the image. If not specified, first the file format corresponding to the file extension in imagePath will be used, and if not available then the same file format of the source image will be used and if that format is not supported for saving, then Jpeg format will be used.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTask.Save(System.IO.Stream,System.Nullable{GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat})
member.summary: Executes all the commands in the chain and saves the resulting image to the specified stream.
member.param: The stream to save the image to.
The file format used to save the image. If not specified, the same file format of the source image will be used and if that format is not supported for saving, then Jpeg format will be used.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTask.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this instance.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat
member.summary: Defines the supported image file formats for saving.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: JPEG (Joint Photographic Experts Group) is the most popular bitmap image format for storing digital photos using lossy compression.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat.Png
member.summary: PNG (Portable Network Graphics) was created to replace the obsolete GIF format due to a legal problem caused by the LZW algorithm used in GIF.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat.Gif
member.summary: GIF (Graphics Interchange Format) is a bitmap image format which works well for saving any type of grayscale or 256 color image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat.WebP
member.summary: WebP is an image format developed by Google Inc. This format provides lossless and lossy compression for images on the web.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat.Bmp
member.summary: BMP (Bitmap Picture) is a standard bitmap image format used to store digital images on Microsoft Windows operating systems.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat.Tiff
member.summary: TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) is a bitmap file format for storing images that is very popular among professional photographers and graphic artists.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat.Eps
member.summary: EPS (Encapsulated PostScript) is a PostScript document used as a graphics file format.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat.Pdf
member.summary: PDF (Portable Document Format) was developed by Adobe Systems, Inc. for secure and reliable distribution of electronic documents independent of software, hardware, and operating system.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1
member.summary: This is a base class for internal use which cannot be instantiated. Use the derived class instead.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Pipeline
member.summary: The pipeline for chaining commands.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.ChangeList
member.summary: The list of chained commands and parameters to be used for generating a hash.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Reader
member.summary: The image reader.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Info
member.summary: Gets the source image information and metadata.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.RunPipeline
member.summary: Executes all the commands in the chain.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Resize(System.Int32,System.Int32,GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode,GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality)
member.summary: Resizes the current image to the given dimensions. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The width of the resulting image.
The height of the resulting image.
The resize mode which is used to resolve aspect ratio differences between the given dimensions and the original image's dimensions.
The interpolation algorithm to use while resizing.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.ResizeWidth(System.Int32,GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality)
member.summary: Resizes the current image to the given width while preserving the aspect ratio. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The width of the resulting image.
The interpolation algorithm to use while resizing.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.ResizeHeight(System.Int32,GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality)
member.summary: Resizes the current image to the given height while preserving the aspect ratio. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The height of the resulting image.
The interpolation algorithm to use while resizing.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Crop(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Crops the current image to the given rectangle. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The cropping rectangle.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Crop(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Crops the current image to the given coordinates and size. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the cropping rectangle.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the cropping rectangle.
The width of the cropping rectangle.
The height of the cropping rectangle.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.CropBorders(System.Drawing.Color,System.Int32)
member.summary: Crops the borders around the current image. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The color of the border to remove.
The sensitivity of the crop between 0 and 100. The higher the value the more color will be cropped.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Rotate(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Drawing.Color},GleamTech.ImageUltimate.TransformQuality)
member.summary: Rotates the current image by the given angle. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The angle in degrees to rotate the image by. A positive degree will cause a clockwise rotation and a negative degree will cause a counter-clockwise rotation. Angles of 90, 180, or 270 degrees will use a special algorithm for higher performance.

The background color for the rotated image. Default color is white. If the rotated image is not rectangular (ie. angle is not 90, 180, or 270 degrees), it will be padded with the background color to get a rectangular image.
The interpolation algorithm to use while transforming.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Flip(GleamTech.ImageUltimate.FlipMode)
member.summary: Flips the current image horizontally, vertically or both. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The flip mode to use.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Brightness(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts brightness of the current image by the given amount. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The brightness amount between -100 and 100. If it is more than 0, the image is brightened (100 will make the image completely white). If it is less than 0, the image is darkened (-100 will make the image completely black). 0 will cause no changes.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.BrightnessAuto
member.summary: Adjusts brightness of the current image by the most appropriate amount that is calculated automatically. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Contrast(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts contrast of the current image by the given amount. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The contrast amount between -100 and 100. If it is more than 0, the contrast is increased (100 will set the image contrast to the maximum). If it is less than 0, the contrast is decreased (-100 will make the image completely gray). 0 will cause no changes.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.ContrastAuto
member.summary: Adjusts contrast of the current image by the most appropriate amount that is calculated automatically. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.BrightnessContrast(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts brightness and contrast of the current image by the given amounts simultaneously. The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The brightness amount between -100 and 100. If it is more than 0, the image is brightened (100 will make the image completely white). If it is less than 0, the image is darkened (-100 will make the image completely black). 0 will cause no changes.

The contrast amount between -100 and 100. If it is more than 0, the contrast is increased (100 will set the image contrast to the maximum). If it is less than 0, the contrast is decreased (-100 will make the image completely gray). 0 will cause no changes.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat
member.summary: Defines the supported pixel formats.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Indexed1
member.summary: 1 bit per pixel indexed color.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Indexed4
member.summary: 4 bits per pixel indexed color.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Indexed8
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel indexed color.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Rgb24
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel RGB color. 8 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Rgb32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel RGB color. 8 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components. The rest 8 bits are unused.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Rgb48
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel RGB color. 16 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components (extended pixel format).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Argb64
member.summary: 64 bits per pixel RGB color with alpha channel. 16 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components (extended pixel format).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Argb32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel RGB color with alpha channel. 8 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Grayscale8
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel Grayscale color. 8 bits are used for luminosity level.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Grayscale16
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel Grayscale color. All 16 bits are used for luminosity level (extended pixel format).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Agrayscale16
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel Grayscale color with alpha channel. 8 bits are used for alpha channel and other 8 bits are used for luminosity level.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Agrayscale32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel Grayscale color with alpha channel. 16 bits are used for alpha channel and other 16 bits are used for luminosity level (extended pixel format).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Cmyk32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel CMYK color. 8 bits each are used for the cyan, magenta, yellow, and black components.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Cmyk64
member.summary: 64 bits per pixel CMYK color. 16 bits each are used for the cyan, magenta, yellow, and black components (extended pixel format).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Acmyk40
member.summary: 40 bits per pixel CMYK color with alpha channel. 8 bits each are used for the alpha, cyan, magenta, yellow, and black components.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Acmyk80
member.summary: 80 bits per pixel CMYK color with alpha channel. 16 bits each are used for the alpha, cyan, magenta, yellow, and black components (extended pixel format).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Lab24
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel Lab color. 8 bits each are used for the A, B, and lightness components.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Lab48
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel Lab color. 16 bits each are used for the A, B, and lightness components (extended pixel format).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Alab32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel Lab color with alpha channel. 8 bits each are used for the alpha, A, B, and lightness components.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormat.Alab64
member.summary: 64 bits per pixel Lab color with alpha channel. 16 bits each are used for the alpha, A, B, and lightness components (extended pixel format).

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo
member.summary: Provides information about a pixel format.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.ColorModel
member.summary: Gets the color space of this pixel format.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.BitDepth
member.summary: Gets the bit depth of this pixel format.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.IsRgb
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this pixel format is RGB.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.IsGrayscale
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this pixel format is Grayscale.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.IsCmyk
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this pixel format is CMYK.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.IsLab
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this pixel format is Lab.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.HasAlpha
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this pixel format supports alpha channel (information about opacity of pixels).

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.IsIndexed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this pixel format is indexed (palette-based, ie. each pixel is an index in palette rather than color value).

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.IsExtended
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this pixel format is extended (i.e. 16 bits per channel).

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.ChannelCount
member.summary: Gets the number of channels available in this pixel format.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.MaxChannelValue
member.summary: Gets a maximum channel value available in this pixel format. 65535 (16 bits) if the pixel format is extended; otherwise 255 (8 bits).

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.Description
member.summary: Gets the user-friendly description of this pixel format.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.PixelFormatInfo.ToString
member.summary: Returns the same value as property.
member.returns: The user-friendly description of this pixel format.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode
member.summary: Defines the resize modes which are used to resolve aspect ratio differences between the requested dimensions and the original image's dimensions.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.Max
member.summary: Width and height are considered maximum values. Either the resulting width or height may be smaller than the given ones to maintain the aspect ratio. The resize will not occur if the image is already smaller than the given size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.MaxFit
member.summary: Same as but the resize will occur even if the image is already smaller than the given size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Width and height are considered exact values and the image is stretched if there is an aspect ratio difference.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.Crop
member.summary: Width and height are considered exact values and cropping is used if there is an aspect ratio difference.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality
member.summary: Defines the possible interpolation algorithms that are used when images are resized.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.High
member.summary: Best quality algorithm with usually lowest speed. The appropriate interpolation algorithm will be automatically selected to reach the desired quality.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Medium
member.summary: Medium quality algorithm with usually medium speed. The appropriate interpolation algorithm will be automatically selected to reach the desired quality.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Low
member.summary: Lowest quality algorithm with usually highest speed. The appropriate interpolation algorithm will be automatically selected to reach the desired quality.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Nearest neighbor is the most basic and requires the least processing time of all the interpolation algorithms because it only considers one pixel - the closest one to the interpolated point. This has the effect of simply making each pixel bigger.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Bilinear
member.summary: Bilinear interpolation considers the closest 2x2 neighborhood of known pixel values surrounding the unknown pixel. It then takes a weighted average of these 4 pixels to arrive at its final interpolated value. This results in much smoother looking images than . Note that this algorithm is not suitable for shrinking an image below 50 percent of its original size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Bicubic
member.summary: Bicubic goes one step beyond by considering the closest 4x4 neighborhood of known pixels - for a total of 16 pixels. Bicubic produces noticeably sharper images than and , and is perhaps the ideal combination of processing time and output quality. Note that this algorithm is not suitable for shrinking an image below 25 percent of its original size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Lanczos
member.summary: This interpolation method is much like except that instead of blurring, it creates a "ringing" pattern. The benefit is that it can handle detailed graphics without blurring like .

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Lanczos3
member.summary: Same as but with increased sharpness.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Supersampling
member.summary: Supersampling is a spatial anti-aliasing method, i.e. a method used to remove aliasing (jagged and pixelated edges, known as "jaggies"). Anti-aliasing removes these jaggies and gives the appearance of smoother edges and higher resolution. For scaling photos (and raster images with many colors), this algorithm should produce best results.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Anisotropic4
member.summary: Anisotropic filtration with 4 points. Similar to but with higher speed.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeQuality.Anisotropic9
member.summary: Anisotropic filtration with 9 points (faster than 4 points). Similar to but with higher speed.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.HtmlHelperExtensions
member.summary: Adds ImageUltimate related extensions methods to class for ASP.NET MVC support.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.HtmlHelperExtensions.Image(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper,System.String,System.Action{GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebTask})
member.summary: Returns an image element with a unique and browser-cacheable url for the processed image. The first time this method is called, the image will be processed and cached on the server. The url will vary according to the processing commands so browser cache will be updated automatically when you change the parameters.
member.param: The instance.

The virtual or physical path to the image to process. If a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is given, it will considered relative to the default source path set by . If the given path is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), the exact path will be used, ie. the default source path will be ignored.
The method for processing the image. This is usually a lambda expression which chains image processing commands.
member.returns: The image element.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.HtmlHelperExtensions.Image(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper,System.String,System.Action{GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebTask},System.Object)
member.summary: Returns an image element with a unique and browser-cacheable url for the processed image. The first time this method is called, the image will be processed and cached on the server. The url will vary according to the processing commands so browser cache will be updated automatically when you change the parameters.
member.param: The instance.

The virtual or physical path to the image to process. If a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is given, it will considered relative to the default source path set by . If the given path is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), the exact path will be used, ie. the default source path will be ignored.
The method for processing the image. This is usually a lambda expression which chains image processing commands.
An object that contains the HTML attributes to set for the element.
member.returns: The image element.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageModule
member.summary: Processes image requests within the web application.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageModule.PreApplicationStart
member.summary: Self registers this module before ASP.NET application is started.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageModule.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: Initializes the module and prepares it to handle requests.
member.param: The HTTP application.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageModule.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the module.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebConfiguration
member.summary: Provides methods for changing this library's global configuration for web use.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebConfiguration.SetCachePath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the virtual path to store cached images.
member.param: The application relative (~/...) or absolute virtual path (/...).

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebConfiguration.SetSourcePath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the default source path for finding images. Whenever a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is given for a image loading/processing method, it will considered relative to this source path. If the given path is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), this source path will be ignored for that method call.
member.param: The virtual or physical path.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebTask
member.summary: Provides methods for processing a source image in a chained manner for web use and caching the resulting image. This class can not be instantiated, it's passed as a parameter to your lambda expression so that you can chain image processing commands.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebTask.Format(GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageSaveFormat)
member.summary: Overrides the file format for the resulting image. By default the same file format of the source image will be used and if that format is not supported for saving, then Jpeg format will be used.
member.param: The file format used to save the image.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebTask.FileName(System.String)
member.summary: Overrides the file name (excluding extension) of the resulting image in the generated url (usually for SEO purposes). By default the same name of the source image will be used. Note that the file extension is appended automatically according to the current save format.
member.param: The file name (excluding extension) to use in the generated url.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock
member.summary: Synchronization helper: a static lock collection associated with a key. NamedLock manages the lifetime of critical sections that can be accessed by a key (name) throughout the application. It also have some helper methods to allow a maximum wait time (timeout) to aquire the lock and safelly release it. Note: this nuget package contains c# source code and depends on System.Collections.Concurrent introduced in .Net 4.0.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.IsLocked
member.summary: Check if a lock was aquired.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.Key
member.summary: Gets the lock key name.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.Lock
member.summary: Gets the internal lock object.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The named lock key.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Releases aquired lock and related resources.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.Enter
member.summary: Tries to aquire a lock.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.Enter(System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to aquire a lock respecting the specified timeout.
member.param: The wait timeout milliseconds.
member.returns: If the lock was aquired in the specified timeout

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.Enter(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Tries to aquire a lock respecting the specified timeout.
member.param: The wait timeout.
member.returns: If the lock was aquired in the specified timeout

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.Exit
member.summary: Releases the lock if it was already aquired. Called also at "Dispose".

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.CreateAndEnter(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance and tries to aquire a lock.
member.param: The named lock key.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.CreateAndEnter(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance and tries to aquire a lock.
member.param: The named lock key.
The wait timeout milliseconds.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.NamedLock.CreateAndEnter(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a new instance and tries to aquire a lock.
member.param: The name of the lock object.
The wait timeout.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.PageExtensions.ImageHtml(System.Web.UI.Page,System.String,System.Action{GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebTask})
member.summary: Returns an image element with a unique and browser-cacheable url for the processed image. The first time this method is called, the image will be processed and cached on the server. The url will vary according to the processing commands so browser cache will be updated automatically when you change the parameters.
member.param: The instance.
The virtual or physical path to the image to process.
The method (usually a lambda expression) for processing the image.

member.summary: Returns an image element with a unique and browser-cacheable url for the processed image. The first time this method is called, the image will be processed and cached on the server. The url will vary according to the processing commands so browser cache will be updated automatically when you change the parameters.
member.param: The instance.

The virtual or physical path to the image to process. If a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is given, it will considered relative to the default source path set by . If the given path is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), the exact path will be used, ie. the default source path will be ignored.
The method for processing the image. This is usually a lambda expression which chains image processing commands.
An object that contains the HTML attributes to set for the element.
member.returns: The image element.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.PageExtensions.ImageUrl(System.Web.UI.Page,System.String,System.Action{GleamTech.ImageUltimate.Web.ImageWebTask})
member.summary: Generates a unique and browser-cacheable url for the processed image. The first time this method is called, the image will be processed and cached on the server. The url will vary according to the processing commands so browser cache will be updated automatically when you change the parameters.
member.param: The instance.

The virtual or physical path to the image to process. If a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is given, it will considered relative to the default source path set by . If the given path is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), the exact path will be used, ie. the default source path will be ignored.
The method for processing the image. This is usually a lambda expression which chains image processing commands.
member.returns: The url to the processed and cached image.
